popt4jlib.MinExplainSet

Class LPWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • popt4jlib.MinExplainSet.LPWriter

  • public class LPWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    class is responsible for writing a general LP, MIP, or pure Binary Program in lp file format understood by most solvers today, including GUROBI, SCIP and glpk. The problem is always specified as: 
     min c'x
 s.t.
 Ax ≤ b
 x ≥ 0
 some x ∈ {0,1}
 some x integer
    . All coefficients in b, c are assumed integer, and in A are assumed double.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2011-2023

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

      static void writeLPFile(double[][] A, int[] b, int[] c, java.lang.String fname)
      writes the Binary Programming problem min c'x subject to Ax ≤ b, x binary to the lp-formatted file fname.

      helper static function that directly writes a constraint in the file.

    • Method Detail

      • writeLPFile

        public static void writeLPFile(double[][] A,
                               int[] b,
                               int[] c,
                               java.lang.String fname)
        writes the Binary Programming problem min c'x subject to Ax ≤ b, x binary to the lp-formatted file fname. The file must have extension ".lp".
        Parameters:
        A - double[][]
        b - int[]
        c - int[]
        fname - String

      • writeRow

        public static void writeRow(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
                            int cnum,
                            float[] Ar,
                            int br)
        helper static function that directly writes a constraint in the file.
        Parameters:
        pw - PrintWriter object
        cnum - int constraint number
        Ar - float[] the coeffs of the row constraint
        br - int the right hand side of the row constraint

      • nextNZCoeffIsPos

        public static boolean nextNZCoeffIsPos(int[] c,
                                       int i)
        checks if the first non-zero coefficient after position i is positive. If all coefficients after position i are zero, or if the first non-zero after i is negative, returns false.
        Parameters:
        c - int[]
        i - int
        Returns:
        boolean
